Print This Page
Cambridge City
MA

Resolution
RES 2025 #89

Congratulations to The Cambridge Program's Basketball Teams - The Warriors capturing their 9th consecutive State Championship win, The Falcons securing silver, and the newest team The Ryders, learning and developing their skills each game.

Information

Department:City Clerk's Office, PTSponsors:Councillor Paul F. Toner
Category:Congratulations

Attachments

Version History
  1. Printout

Body

WHEREAS:

The City of Cambridge has learned that The Cambridge Program has enjoyed a highly successful 2024-2025 Basketball Season; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

Guided by the steadfast motto “Effort is Everything” The Cambridge Program is a recreational program serving individuals with special needs in the Cambridge area and is dedicated to enhancing the lives of its participants by providing quality programs that promote self-esteem, encourage social interaction, and improve physical well-being, with a goal to foster an inclusive and empathetic community through programing that emphasizes health, fitness, care, respect, and appreciation of differences; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

The Cambridge Basketball Program proudly fielded three basketball teams during the 2024-2025 season:

·         The Warriors, who captured their 9th consecutive State Championship Win on April 6th, 2025.

·         The Falcons, who secured an impressive 2nd place finish in their division at the State Championship.

·         The Ryders, the program’s newest team, who have demonstrated tremendous enthusiasm, sportsmanship, and growth in every game; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

On April 2, 2025, both The Warriors and The Falcons were honored with the opportunity to play at The Boston Garden during the pre-game and during half-time shows - an exciting moment that showcased their talent and represented the City of Cambridge with pride; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

Capping off the program’s extraordinary season, following their State Championship Victory, The Cambridge Warriors received a special message from Derrick White of the World Champion Boston Celtics, inviting them to represent Team Massachusetts at the 2026 Special Olympics USA Games in Minnesota in June 2026; now therefore be it

 

 

RESOLVED:

That the City Council go on record congratulating the participants of The Cambridge Program’s Basketball teams for their outstanding achievements, dedication, and hard work throughout the season, and extends its best wishes for continued success in the future; and be it further

 

 

RESOLVED:

That the City Clerk be and hereby is requested to forward a suitably engrossed copy of this resolution to The Cambridge Program on behalf of the entire City Council.
